title: Raghurajpur Terracotta
hero_image_alt: Clay toys and figures drying in Raghurajpur
short_description: Delicate clay toys and masks created by the artisans of the heritage village Raghurajpur.
long_description:
Raghurajpur, famous for Pattachitra, also has a thriving terracotta tradition. The artisans here create small clay toys, animal figures (horses, elephants), and masks. Unlike the large structural terracotta of Bengal, the work here is often smaller, sometimes painted brightly, or left in a natural fired finish.

The 'Cow dung toys' are a variant where cow dung is mixed with clay and paper mache to create lightweight but sturdy figures.
motifs_and_meanings: Vahanas: Animals as vehicles of gods.

major_centres.title: Raghurajpur Heritage Village
major_centres.summary: A village where every house is an artist's studio.

authenticity_tips: Buy directly from the makers in the village.
